boardgame.name: Les croisés du Temps
Khronos
크로노스
boardgame.description: In this game, you play a powerful lord and his faithful companion engaged in a fight for influence throughout time. The game proceeds simultaneously over three different periods. You start the game in the Middle Ages, on the first of the three game boards (that of the commanderies). With 4 action cards in hand per turn, you have seven turns in which to develop your domains by building various types of military, religious, and civil buildings. Depending on their size, certain buildings are moved in time, which means that they are transferred to the same place on the priories board (Renaissance period) and on the brotherhoods board (modern period), in ruins for military and religious buildings (castles, abbeys_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;hellip;)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Thanks to the watch makers' invention, and with enough money, you can make your two adventurer pawns travel in time_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;hellip; Because if the construction of certain buildings can be profitable, taking over domains on the various boards is essential, since it will allow you to earn bonuses on the 4th and 7th turns and to move ahead of your opponents._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Playing with time is not without consequences, and it can produce surprising results! To give just one example, an abbey created on the priories board could be destroyed by a castle built later in the game in the same place but on the commanderies board, and then moved to the other board_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;hellip; The abbey finally never existed!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;On the 4th and 7th turns, each controlled domain generates profits for the players depending on the board. On the the commanderies board, a player who controls a domain militarily, i.e. the one with the biggest military building, will receive the value of the civil buildings in this domain in profits. On the priories board, it is the religious control that will be taken into account. On the brotherhoods board, the players who have best populated the civil buildings and restored the ruins will secure the best profits._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The possibility of destroying and regrouping buildings to unite or divide domains provides a strong and permanent level of interaction between the players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2008 Games Magazine Best New Advanced Strategy Game Winner

Brand new in shrink. Has two small box-cutter slices across the box top (one 3_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, the other 2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;). The shrink has split at these cuts. Rio Grande Games (RIO 332) The Master Clocksmith came to speak to me this morning revealing a fabulous secret... We can travel in time, my friend! Not just dreaming about it like my astrologist does, but actually going there. I can hardly believe it! There seem to be periods in our future where the strength of our walls will be nothing compared to the strength of our collective faith. Or an even stranger future epoch where the people will rule themselves. The Master Clocksmith has convinced me that our power is now limitless. Our lands and domains are ours forever. My opponents will not wait and my Lords have already started preparing for their journeys. My dear friend, come with me, for from this day forward, I will be remembered as the king who forged our own destiny... literally!

The game itself is in very good condition. However this is a former World Boardgaming Championships gaming library item which was sold through the WBC Game auction in 2013, where I purchased it. They mark their library games with stickers saying, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Property of..._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and they then cover those stickers with another saying _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Sold at the WBC auction_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. So there are a few of these stickers on the outside of the box. So this is obvisouly a gamers copy, not a collectors copy which is why I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m selling it cheaply.

This item also includes: Mystery Express Hoity Toity (Adel Verpflichtet) Um Reifenbreite Domaine (Loewenherz) Slapshot! This is for the winning bidder of my auction: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/169062/bundles-of-joy-were-getting-married-fundraiser-g

This edition states on the box that there are 33 action cards, but the rules state that there are 55 (18+18+19 with one more Reason card than Might and Faith). My copy, which I traded for in 2011, has exactly 54 cards, with 18 of each action type. This _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;missing card_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; should have absolutely no effect on the play of the game. Some devotees of Khronos have substituted colored cubes drawn out of a bag as a card substitute and find this method quite satisfactory.
One box corner is slightly damaged, see pic. The rest of the game is in great condition. 2nd edition cards and pawns. English rules printed in the box as well. The game is 1.7kg weight.
